Amazing game. I definitely recommend going through this experience at least once in your lifetime

From chapter 6-7, it felt like I wasn't playing Portal 2 anymore. (in a good way). This game is incredible and there's no denying it. It's jam-packed full of content and can get very creative. 

After finishing Portal 1, I felt that it was a bit lacking in things to do. It made a hole in my heart. But that hole was fixed shortly after when I stumbled across the sequel. The puzzles felt rewarding to solve and gave me the motivation to keep going through each test chamber. GLaDOS' dialogue was out of context at times but still comedic. Wheatley wasn't as random but it was cool when he popped on screen. And of course, the companion cube only appeared in one level but made a good appearance.

This game is truly a masterpiece, being one of the few sequels to be BETTER than the original.
If you have not already, i highly recommend picking it up, It's only $14.50 AUD. and is well worth the price.

Oh, and the line "BECAUSE I'M A POTATO!" is the funniest line in the game to me.

10/10: Best 15 bucks you will ever spend.

Chapter Ten: The Part Where I Review The Game

9/10
Игра прикольная и интересная. Ей можно размять мозги и при этом повеселиться. Например в кооперативном режиме прикалываться над своим другом.
pretty fun but literally 5 times out of 10 you will need a walkthrough if youre as braindead as me but its the SEQUEL???!!!???? 10/10

An amazing sequel to an amazing game. Great puzzles, great story, great coop, so much greatness too it. My only complaint is that the game has two sections it likes to switch between, the puzzle chamber bits, and the story heavy bits, where there are very few puzzles. I wish that these two types of gameplay were integrated with each other a little more, so we could have gotten a little more story during the puzzle chambers and a little more puzzles during the story bits. Still, Portal 2 is another Valve game that is a must-play experience for everyone.

Second playthrough, the jokes just do not get old :).
